item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Kape:

Restock (2 use): Increase target players limited night abilities uses by 1. Cannot go above max. Can target self.

Can target self and won’t consume a charge if you do.

Right now it negates it’s own effect because using it consumes a charge but then the effect itself gives it right back. So it needs to not consume a charge when self targeting in order for it to work properly.

item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Kape:

Your New Clothes: If a player visits someone dressed up as their class, their ability will be prevented bypassing immunities. You will keep this passive if your class changes.

I’d like to note that immunity bypasses were removed.

You could substitute the intended effect by having it be “they will be occupied and their target will become occupy and redirect immune that night”

This also has the benefit of making the ability more versatile, which is fine because I consider the class highly situational at the moment.

item.title: Smith, Commoner, Merchant, Tailor (BD Supp, Soc, Inv, Off) and their converts
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Kape:

Collect Dues (inf use): Mark a player. If they are already marked, you will get a list of every player they visited this game.

Note that I’m going to assume the answer to all of my questions are no.

Against Unseen this class is fine, since while it usually confirms the assassin if marked it won’t confirm the MM or the converts if applicable.

However against the Cult this is sometimes OP. If you check the starting CL then not only can you match the Kill visits up to determine that they are in fact the CL (which by itself would be fine) but more importantly you can retroactively determine who the converts are (players that weren’t attacked but were visited).

It’s not fundumentally a problem, but there may need to be a failsafe of some sort to ensure that you can’t immediately out the entire cult minus 1 with just 2 ability uses.

item.title: Smith, Commoner, Merchant, Tailor (BD Supp, Soc, Inv, Off) and their converts
item.dc:creator: katze
item.description:
Kape:

It’s not that confirmable at least early game.

Sure, but I don’t think a Support class should have an easy to confirm ability like that. And generally I think we can both agree on mechanical confirms = not good. At least heals require you to be on the right target on the right day, this just requires someone to have used a limited use ability. Which isn’t extremely hard to arrange, really.

I know you mentioned whether or not it should work on killer classes, and I think it shouldn’t. Giving Hunter more bears, Prince more exes, Assassin more 2F1s, and Poss more Jumps all seem a bit too powerful. Especially since Prince would be an easy one to hardconfirm with, since they can just exe a neut n3.

If someone were to use their first use of a limited use ability, such as Prince exeing n3, and you use the ability on them N3, would they still lose a use?

Arete:

If a Commoner becomes King it hardconfirms all RB claims as fake

I somehow missed this when I wrote most of my initial post. Would they just not have the ability to step, or would votes for them just be nullified? Because if they can’t step, then there’s some big hardconfirm problems here. Fakeclaiming most royals is already pretty hard.

no

yes

but what if no

item.title: Smith, Commoner, Merchant, Tailor (BD Supp, Soc, Inv, Off) and their converts
item.dc:creator: Kape
item.description:
Smith and Smelter - Support

The Smith
BD Support

Passive:
Pacifist: You are unable to restock Killer classes.

Day:
Overwork (1 use): Your night abilities will be able to target 2 players tonight. Occupy yourself the next night.

Night:
Mold The Metal (2 use): Grant a player death immunity for the night.
Restock (2 use): Increase target players limited night abilities uses by 1. Cannot go above max. Can target self.

The Smelter
Unseen Support

Day:
Melt Down (inf use): Pick a non-unique Blue Dragon class. You will be able to use it’s primary night ability tonight with Tools Of The Trade.

Night:
Tools Of The Trade (3 use): Use an ability you picked up with Melt Down.
Sharpen Blade (2 use): Sharpen the Assassins sword making his attack unhealable for this night.

Commoner and Serf - Social

The Commoner
BD Social

Passive:
Commonfolk: You cannot become King if a royal is still alive. You will keep this passive if your class changes.

Day:
United We Stand (1 use): All healing abilities that target you tonight will also target any other Commoner.

Night:
Greetings (inf use): If your target visits you tonight, you will be able to talk with them during the following nights. You can talk to multiple people at the same time.
Small Talk (inf use): The first time you whisper your target the next day, it will be hidden.

The Serf
Unseen Social

Passive:
Commonfolk: You cannot become King if a royal is still alive. You will keep this passive if your class changes.
Pseudo Lords: The other Unseen members will receive an additional vote for each vote they got during the King election.

Day:
Contact (inf use): The next whisper you send will be hidden.

Night:
Greetings (inf use): If your target visits you tonight, you will be able to talk with them during the following nights. You can talk to multiple people at the same time.
Uninvited Guests (inf use): Add an Unseen member to your night chat. They will be able to additionally talk there the following nights.

Merchant and Smuggler - Investigative

The Merchant
BD Investigative

Passive:
Set Up Shop: Everyone who visits you will become marked.

Day:
Doorbell (2 use): You will know how many players visit you tonight.

Night:
Collect Dues (inf use): Mark a player. If they are already marked, you will get a list of every player they visited this game.
Hire (1 use): Hire target player and redirect everyone attacking you into them tonight.

The Smuggler
Unseen Investigative

Passive:
Exotic Wares: You will know who visited you each night.

Night:
Special Offer (inf use): You will get a list of every player your target visited this game.
Pay Off (2 use): Target a player and an Unseen member. The player will target the Unseen, but believe he targetted his original target.

Tailor and Seemstress - Offensive

The Tailor
BD Offensive

Passive:
Your New Clothes: If a player visits someone dressed up as their class, their ability will be prevented bypassing immunities. You will keep this passive if your class changes.

Night:
Dress Up (inf use): Target 2 players. Dress up the first one as the other. You will occupy either of your targets if someone else visits them tonight.
Blue Strings (2 use): Target 2 players. Redirect them into each other.

The Seamstress
Unseen Offensive

Passive:
Your New Clothes: If a player visits someone dressed up as their class, their ability will be prevented bypassing immunities. You will keep this passive if your class changes.

Night:
Dress Up (inf use): Target 2 players. Dress up the first one as the other. You will occupy either of your targets if someone else visits them tonight.
Purple Strings (2 use): Target 2 players. Redirect them into each other.

This is a WIP. Still missing the Smelter convert, but it shouldn’t take that long to do, right? 12 days later, he’s here!
Made in like 3-4 hours.
Originally I planned on making a BD Killer + convert too, but yeah, it proved too difficult.

Please give feedback and ideas
